December 15, 1964
Mr. Lou Peneguy
Director, Coordination and Information
Alabama Educational Television Commission
2151 Highland Avenue
Birmingham, Alabama 35205
Dear Lou:
I am very sorry to be so slow reacting to your letter of
October 20 to Marion Corwell regarding the possibility of
an educational broadcasting exhibit at the World’s Fair
next summer. A convention and two other meetings have taken
place since Marion forwarded your letter to me, thus the
delay.
Our Executive staff has given serious thought to this sugges¬
tion and we feel that it Bimply is not feasible for the HASH
(even in cooperation with NET) to undertake such an exhibit.
Even if the space were to be donated to us, there are still
several other factors to be considered.
In the first place the Hall of Education and the communica¬
tions "show*' both leave something to be desired, and it may
do us more harm than good to exhibit in either. Secondly,
there would be the cost of preparing a worthwhile exhibit
which would run into $2,000. Thirdly, there is the problem
of staffing the exhibit. We feel that no exhibit should be
left unattended and that no static exhibit does much for the
exhibitor. We would not be in a position to provide someone
to staff it nor to pay the cost of having it staffed.
It would Indeed have been a fine idea to have a NAEB-KET
exhibit in the Hall of Education if all of the above ftctors
did not weigh so heavily against it.
Harold E. Hill
HEH/mlm
cc: Marion Corwe
